title: The duchess of downplaying it: How Meghan is using “low-key” royal-tour fashion to retool her image
text:
During the early months of her marriage, the Duchess of Sussex’s wardrobe credits read like a roll call of the world’s most lavish luxury fashion houses. There was Christian Dior, there was Prada, there was Oscar de la Renta, there was Carolina Herrera⁠—and boy, was there ever Givenchy haute couture. Meghan donned designer Clare Waight Keller’s couture shirtdresses and cape-necked sheaths as readily as most of us wear jeans.

And that’s understandable. Truly. After all, she’s among the elite 0.00001% of women in British society who have occasion to wear diamond tiaras beyond their wedding days. We want our princesses to look like princesses, even when they’re duchesses.
description: During the early months of her marriage, the Duchess of Sussex’s wardrobe credits read like a roll call of the world’s most lavish luxury fashion houses.
